intro: Piper parvibracteatum, commonly known as the small-bract pepper vine, is a tropical climbing plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes numerous species of pepper plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces small, greenish-white flowers that develop into elongated, narrow fruits. Its botanical characteristics make it distinct from other Piper species, particularly in its bract structure and growth habit. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
